page.title: 16Today's Farming In Waltham.
page.content: The farming land in our block is mainly arable.No longer is there the four crop rotation system as nowadays farmers plant four or five cereal crops, wheat and barley following each other. They can use fertilisers to enrich the land and provide the nutrients the crops need.Most farmers use new, improved corn varieties which are sown in September and harvested in July or August.They produce more tonnes per acre because of the longer growing time. Linseed rape and sugar beet are used as profitable break-crops. Since the second world war farmers have used bigger machines, in particular tractors.These pull highly developed implements to do the work previously done manually.As a result fewer men are needed to work increasingly larger areas.
